summary: Add to the game the mechanics of the dependence of speed and regeneration of the stamina on the weight of the inventory, as in the dark souls 2
descriptionHtml:
[size=3]     Is there a difference between [color=#00ffff]10[/color]% inventory and [color=#ff7700]90[/color]%? Itis not!  % change in the weight of the inventory does not affect the character in any way.
This mod changes it. It introduces the mechanics of the dependence of speed of movement and restoration of stamina on the load of inventory.
Similar you could see in the game Dark Souls 2.
    Now the load of the character affects it: the morethings you carry, the slower you move. The rate of  stamina varies, too.
Every 25% of the inventory load will change your movement speed and stamina recovery rate.
    Mod was developed for Requiem (but doesn't depend on it), so it is fully compatible and complements its mechanics of penalties from the weight of the outfit.
[/size][size=4]
[/size][size=4][center]﻿﻿Install[/center][/size][size=2][center]([i]If you play the game with requiem[/i])[/center]
[/size][size=3]Connect the mod [u][color=#ff0000]strictly[/color][/u] [b]after[/b] Requiem initializes its scripts.[/size] 

[center][size=4]﻿You need to know:
[/size][/center][size=3]Mod applies itschanges not immediately, but after 10-12 seconds. This is done specifically to minimize the load on the Skyrim script engine.[/size]

[size=4][center][/center][center]﻿More details[/center]

[/size][size=3]If weight of your inventory:
[spoiler]
[b][color=#00ff00]<25%[/color][/b]  - bonus to speed and recovery of the stamina
[b][color=#6aa84f]<50%[/color][/b] - little  bonus to speed and recovery of the stamina
[color=#f1c232]50%-75% [/color]- original values ([/size][size=2]or a values Requiem. If you play the game with Requiem[/size][size=3])
[b][color=#b45f06]>75%[/color][/b] - a penalty to the speed of movement and restoration of the stamina
[/spoiler]
[/size]
[center]﻿[/center][size=4][center]FAQ[/center][/size][size=3][b]Q[/b].  I saw several mods that do the same. What are the differences?
[b]A[/b][b].[/b]  [i]Before creating the mod, I looked at the available analogs. In those mods, there were either too many extra functions. [/i][i]Either they had user complaints. [/i][i]In any case, they were not developed taking into account the mechanic Requiem.[/i]
 
[b]Q.[/b] Is it possible to accelerate the application of achange from this mod?
